00059 class FeStatListBase_t {
00060 public:
00061 
00062 protected:
00063   typedef StatObj_t *StatObjPtr;
00064   
00065 private:
00066   std::map< unsigned int, std::vector< std::vector< StatObjPtr> > >  _feInfo;
00067 
00068 public:
00076   void show(const char *label);
00077 protected:
00078 
00079   ~FeStatListBase_t();
00080   
00086   StatObjPtr &getStat(unsigned int board_id) {
00087     CALICE::BoardID decoded_board_id(board_id);
00088 
00089     // search for the crate 
00090     std::map<unsigned int, std::vector< std::vector< StatObjPtr > > >::iterator crate_iter=_feInfo.find(decoded_board_id.getCrateID());
00091     if ( crate_iter == _feInfo.end()) {
00092       std::pair< std::map<unsigned int, std::vector< std::vector< StatObjPtr > > >::iterator , bool > ret;
00093       ret=_feInfo.insert(make_pair(decoded_board_id.getCrateID(), std::vector< std::vector< StatObjPtr > >()) );
00094       if (!ret.second) {
00095         throw std::runtime_error("CrcFeConfigurationDataDriver::getStat> Failed to gather statistics about a certain front-end (out of memory?).");
00096       }
00097       crate_iter=ret.first;
00098     }
00099 
00100     // search for the slot
00101     unsigned int slot=decoded_board_id.getSlotID();
00102 
00103     // It is assumed that the number of slots is small. Therefore,
00104     // for each crate a linear array is created for at least 22 slots
00105     // the array will be increased if a slot number is larger.
00106     // If there are many empty slots >32 than this implementation
00107     // is highly inefficient.
00108     
00109     // there are now dummy slots with a slot id  above 22
00110     //#ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00111     // A crate should have a fairly limited number of slots.
00112     //    assert( slot <= 32 );
00113     //#endif      
00114     if (slot>=22) {
00115       slot=22;
00116     }
00117     if (crate_iter->second.size() <= slot) {
00118       crate_iter->second.resize( (slot < 23 ? 23 : slot+1) );
00119     }
00120 
00121     // search for the front-end
00122     unsigned int board_component_nr=decoded_board_id.getBoardComponentNumber();
00123 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00124     assert (slot < crate_iter->second.size() );
00125     assert (board_component_nr < 32 );
00126 #endif
00127     
00128     if (crate_iter->second[slot].size() <= board_component_nr) {
00129       crate_iter->second[slot].resize( ( board_component_nr < 7 ? 8 : board_component_nr+1) );
00130     }
00131     
00132 #ifdef BOUNDARY_CHECK
00133     assert (board_component_nr < crate_iter->second[slot].size() );
00134 #endif
00135     return crate_iter->second[slot][board_component_nr];
00136   };
00137 
00138 };
00139 
00143 template <class T_StatObj_t>
00144 class FeStatList_t : public FeStatListBase_t
00145 {
00146 public:
00153   T_StatObj_t &getStat(unsigned int board_id) {
00154      StatObjPtr &a_ptr=FeStatListBase_t::getStat(board_id);
00155      if (!a_ptr) {
00156        a_ptr=new T_StatObj_t;
00157      }
00158      return *(static_cast<T_StatObj_t*>(a_ptr));
00159   };
00160 };
00161 #endif
